cab.content: From Sir P. Cox, Bagdad, 30th April 19.17.(Addressed to Foreign, repeated to Secretary of State for India andPolitical, Basra.)(Received at India Office 1st May, 1 p.m.)T. 2406. In continuation, of my T. -1254, dated 20th April. Following is result of analysis of Basra Vilayet: Executive personnel. About half perfectly indifferent.Administrative personnel. AH' leading officials were Turks and all principal subordinates in judicial, medical, customs, police and education. In last named all head men were Turks.Practically all posts requiring technical knowledge were held by Turks appointed from Constantinople aud not by Walis. Natives of Mosul, Kurkuk and Sulaimanieh counted as non-Turks, otherwise proportion of Turks would be much larger.
